name: vscode-codechef
description: Your personal AI DevOps Team, orchestrated by the Head Chef.

chatParticipants.name: chef
chatParticipants.description: LangGraph orchestrator with LangChain function calling. Access 150+ tools routed through internal agent nodes (feature-dev, code-review, infrastructure, cicd, documentation). 80-90% token cost reduction via progressive disclosure.

commands.name: orchestrate
commands.description: Submit a development task to the orchestrator

commands.name: status
commands.description: Check the status of a submitted task

commands.name: execute
commands.description: Execute a task with the orchestrator (Agent mode)

codechef.apiKey.description: API key for authenticating with the code/chef orchestrator.
codechef.apiKey.markdownDescription: API key for authenticating with the code/chef orchestrator. Required for production use. Get this from your administrator or generate one with `python -c "import secrets; print(secrets.token_urlsafe(32))"`

enumDescriptions: Full-power models (llama3.3-70b, codellama-13b) - Best quality
Cheaper models for testing (llama3-8b) - 40-60% cost savings
codechef.environment.markdownDescription:
**Environment Profile**

| Profile | Models | Cost |
|---------|--------|------|
| production | llama3.3-70b, codellama-13b | $0.20-0.60/1M tokens |
| development | llama3-8b (all agents) | $0.20/1M tokens |

*Switch to development for testing and experimentation*

codechef.useStreaming.description: Enable real-time streaming responses in chat.
codechef.useStreaming.markdownDescription:
**Enable Streaming Responses** âš¡

When enabled, chat responses are streamed token-by-token for a more natural conversation flow.

- **Enabled**: Real-time SSE streaming (recommended)
- **Disabled**: Full response after processing

*Disable if experiencing connection issues or prefer full responses*

enumDescriptions: Only tools mentioned in task (5-10 tools, 80-95% savings) - Fastest
Start minimal, expand as needed (10-30 tools, 70-85% savings) - Recommended
Load from agent profile (20-40 tools, 60-80% savings)
All 150+ tools (no savings) - Debugging only
codechef.toolLoadingStrategy.description: How many MCP tools to expose to the LLM.
codechef.toolLoadingStrategy.markdownDescription:
**Tool Loading Strategy** ðŸ”§

Controls token usage by limiting exposed tools:

| Strategy | Tools | Token Savings | Use Case |
|----------|-------|---------------|----------|
| `minimal` | 5-10 | 80-95% | Simple tasks |
| `progressive` | 10-30 | 70-85% | **Recommended** |
| `agent_profile` | 20-40 | 60-80% | Complex tasks |
| `full` | 150+ | 0% | Debugging |

codechef.maxToolsPerRequest.description: Maximum tools per request. Lower = fewer tokens.
codechef.maxToolsPerRequest.markdownDescription:
**Maximum Tools Per Request**

Caps the number of tools exposed to the LLM regardless of strategy.

- Default: 30 (balanced)
- Minimum: 5 (most restrictive)
- Maximum: 150 (all tools)

*Lower values reduce token costs but may limit capabilities*

codechef.enableContext7Cache.description: Cache library IDs locally (90% savings on library lookups)
codechef.enableContext7Cache.markdownDescription:
**Context7 Library Cache** ðŸ“š

When enabled, library ID lookups use the local Qdrant cache instead of calling Context7 API.

- Cache: `library_registry` collection (56 libraries)
- Savings: ~1,000 tokens per library lookup
- Libraries: LangChain, FastAPI, Pydantic, OpenAI, etc.

codechef.maxContextTokens.description: Token budget for agent context (code + tools + RAG)
codechef.maxContextTokens.markdownDescription:
**Context Token Budget** ðŸ“Š

Total tokens available for each agent's context:

| Component | Default Allocation |
|-----------|-------------------|
| Code snippets | 3,000 tokens |
| Tool descriptions | 2,000 tokens |
| RAG results | 2,000 tokens |
| Response | 1,000 tokens |

*Lower values reduce costs but may affect response quality*

codechef.maxResponseTokens.markdownDescription:
**Maximum Response Tokens**

Limits the length of agent responses.

- Default: 2,000 (balanced)
- Minimum: 500 (brief responses)
- Maximum: 8,000 (detailed responses)

*Shorter responses = faster + cheaper*

codechef.ragEnabled.description: Include RAG context in agent prompts
codechef.ragEnabled.markdownDescription:
**RAG Context**

When enabled, agents receive relevant context from vector database:

- Code patterns (505 vectors)
- Issue tracker (155 vectors)
- Vendor docs (94 vectors)
- Library registry (56 vectors)

*Disable to reduce context size for simple tasks*

codechef.ragMaxResults.markdownDescription:
**RAG Results Limit**

How many semantic search results to include in agent context.

- Default: 5 (balanced)
- Minimum: 1 (most focused)
- Maximum: 20 (comprehensive)

*Each result adds ~200-500 tokens*

enumDescriptions: Python code patterns and AST analysis (505 vectors)
Linear issues and project context (155 vectors)
API documentation for vendors (94 vectors)
Context7 library ID cache (56 vectors)
Feature specifications and PRDs (4 vectors)
codechef.ragCollection.description: Primary RAG collection for context retrieval

codechef.dailyTokenBudget.markdownDescription:
**Daily Token Budget** ðŸ’°

Set a daily limit to prevent unexpected costs.

- `0` = Unlimited (default)
- Suggested: `100000` for light use
- Suggested: `500000` for heavy use

*Requests will be blocked when budget is exhausted*

codechef.showTokenUsage.description: Show token usage after each request
codechef.showTokenUsage.markdownDescription:
**Token Usage Display**

When enabled, shows token count in responses:

```
âœ“ Task completed (1,234 tokens | $0.0007)
```

*Helps track costs and optimize usage*

codechef.costAlertThreshold.description: Show warning when single request exceeds this cost ($)
codechef.costAlertThreshold.markdownDescription:
**Cost Alert Threshold**

Show a warning notification when a single request costs more than this amount.

- Default: $0.10
- Set to 0 to disable

*Helps catch unexpectedly expensive operations*

enumDescriptions: Auto-approve low-risk tasks (documentation, minor fixes)
Auto-approve medium-risk tasks (code changes, tests)
Auto-approve high-risk tasks (infrastructure, deployments)
Auto-approve all tasks including critical (not recommended)
Never auto-approve - require manual approval for all tasks
codechef.autoApproveThreshold.description: Auto-approve tasks at or below this risk level

codechef.enableNotifications.description: Show toast notifications for approval requests

codechef.linearHubIssue.description: Linear issue ID for approval notifications

codechef.linearWorkspaceSlug.description: Linear workspace slug for approval links

codechef.linearTeamId.description: Linear team ID - @chef can create projects and access all issues under this team (code-chef/CHEF)

enumDescriptions: Automatically select workflow based on task description (recommended)
Feature development with code review and testing
PR deployment with staging and production rollout
Emergency hotfix with fast-track approval
Infrastructure changes with Terraform/Docker
Documentation updates only
codechef.defaultWorkflow.description: Default workflow to use for tasks
codechef.defaultWorkflow.markdownDescription:
**Default Workflow**

Select the default workflow for orchestrated tasks:

| Workflow | Use Case |
|----------|----------|
| `auto` | Smart selection based on task |
| `feature` | Standard feature development |
| `pr-deployment` | PR review + deployment |
| `hotfix` | Emergency fixes |
| `infrastructure` | IaC changes |
| `docs-update` | Documentation only |

codechef.workflowAutoExecute.description: Automatically execute selected workflow without confirmation
codechef.workflowAutoExecute.markdownDescription:
**Auto-Execute Workflows**

When enabled, workflows start immediately after selection.

When disabled, you'll be prompted to confirm before execution.

codechef.workflowConfirmThreshold.description: Confidence threshold for requiring workflow confirmation (0.0-1.0)
codechef.workflowConfirmThreshold.markdownDescription:
**Confirmation Threshold**

If the smart router's confidence is below this threshold, you'll be prompted to confirm the workflow selection.

- `0.0` = Always auto-select (no confirmation)
- `0.7` = Default (confirm low-confidence selections)
- `1.0` = Always confirm

codechef.showWorkflowPreview.description: Show workflow preview before execution (dry run mode)
codechef.showWorkflowPreview.markdownDescription:
**Workflow Preview**

When enabled, shows a preview of the selected workflow including:
- Steps to be executed
- Agents involved
- Estimated duration
- Risk level

Useful for reviewing complex workflows before execution.

codechef.langsmithUrl.description: LangSmith project URL for viewing traces

codechef.enhancePrompts.description: Use Copilot to enhance task descriptions before sending to orchestrator (adds 1-2s latency)
codechef.enhancePrompts.markdownDescription:
**Prompt Enhancement** ðŸ¤–

When enabled, uses your selected Copilot model to expand ambiguous requests into detailed specifications before sending to the orchestrator.

- **Enabled**: Enhanced prompts (adds 1-2s latency)
- **Disabled**: Raw prompts (faster, default)

*Useful for vague requests like 'fix the bug' or 'add tests'*

enumDescriptions: Detailed: Maximum context and specifications
Structured: Balanced structure with key details (recommended)
Minimal: Light enhancement, preserve user style
codechef.enhancementTemplate.markdownDescription:
**Enhancement Style**

Controls how much the prompt is expanded:

| Style | Use Case | Example |
|-------|----------|---------|
| `detailed` | Complex tasks | Full specs with acceptance criteria |
| `structured` | **Recommended** | Clear goals and constraints |
| `minimal` | Simple tasks | Brief additions only |

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
